ORDER
Dated this the 6th day of January 2020

The petitioner is an accused in
Crime No.897/2019 of Nedumbassery Police
Station, for having allegedly committed
offences punishable under Sections 468 and 471
of the IPC and r/w Section 12(1)(b) of the
Passport Act.

2. Vide order dated 27.08.2019, the
petitioner was granted bail by the Sessions
Court on certain conditions. The petitioner has
been following the conditions so far. The
petitioner filed a Crl.M.P.2384/2019 before the
Sessions Court for modifying the condition
Nos.3 and 7, but the same was rejected by the
court. Condition Nos.3 and 7 reads thus:

“3. The petitioner shall appear before the
Investigating Officer on every Saturday
between 9 a.m. andi10a.m, till the final

oe
2020/KER/104
Crl.MC.No.7194 OF 2019 (H)
3
report is filed.
7. The petitioner shall not leave Ernakulam

District without getting prior permission of

this court.”

3. The petitioner hails from Punjab, and
finds it difficult to appear before the
investigating officer on every Saturday between
9 a.m and 10 a.m as required in condition No.3.
Condition No.7 also insist that he shall not
leave Ernakulam without getting permission of
the court.

4. The petitioner has approached this Court
stating that, the order of the Sessions Court
at Annexure-Al specifically states that, no
offence under Section 468 of the IPC is
attracted. If that being so what is attracted
is only non bailable offence and imposing of
such conditions to appear before the
investigating officer every week and creating

oe

2020/KER/104

Crl.MC.No.7194 OF 2019 (H)
4

an embargo on leaving the district would amount
to refusal of the bail and therefore, such
conditions cannot be imposed in a bailable
offence.

5. Heard learned counsel appearing for the
petitioner and the learned senior Public
Prosecutor.

6. The petitioner hails from Punjab, and on
the apprehension that he may not be available
for trial, the court imposed certain conditions
while granting him bail. It is true that the
court has expressed a view that Section 468 of
the IPC may not be attracted considering the
facts and circumstances of the case. However,
the argument of the learned counsel that no
conditions at all can be imposed where the
offence is bailable is not acceptable to this
Court.

|
2020/KER/104
Crl.MC.No.7194 OF 2019 (H)
5

7. However, I find that the investigation
has progressed well and the petitioner has been
complying with the conditions so far without
fail. The learned Public Prosecutor also
submits that the investigation is almost
complete and the final report will be filed
within a short period. The conditions are also
to be complied only till the final report is
filed.

Considering the facts and circumstances of
the case, I find that, the condition No.3
requiring the appearance of the petitioner
before the investigating officer on every
Saturday shall be relaxed and the petitioner
shall hereinafter appear before the
investigating officer once in two months. The
condition No.7 preventing him from leaving
Ernakulam District is also lifted. The

i
2020/KER/104
Crl.MC.No.7194 OF 2019 (H)
6
investigating officer is directed file a final
report expeditiously.
The Crl.M.C is disposed of as above.

ASHOK MENON
